Figure 2:Different Voice Cloning Approaches in AR Transformer.The dotted line represents a provided example of a text-to-speech pair.

Figure 3:An overview of the proposed latent flow matching Architecture.(a) The Flow-VAE model consists of an encoder, which is used to extract continuous speech featuresz𝑧zitalic_z, and a decoder, which is used to restore continuous speech features back to waveforms, and a flow model, which converts the distribution of continuous speech features to a standard normal distribution.z𝑧zitalic_zrepresents continuous speech features, which is the target for the flow matching model to generate. (b) The flow matching model, which conditions on AR transformer outputc𝑐citalic_c, a speaker embeddingv𝑣vitalic_v, provided continuous speech featuresxpsubscript𝑥𝑝x_{p}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPTand intermediate statextsubscript𝑥𝑡x_{t}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPTat timestept𝑡titalic_ton the probabilistic density path.c′superscript𝑐′c^{\prime}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPTrepresents the output of AR transformer after upsampling. The dotted box indicates the provided prompt information.
